summary:
Key Takeaways from Chorus Q4 FY25 Connections Update:

  • Fibre Growth & Usage:
  • Fibre connections increased by 8k to 1,115,000 (offsetting a 6k decline in copper).
  • Average monthly data usage rose to 671GB (from 642GB in April); 19% of users now consume >1TB/month.

  • Hyperfibre connections near 5,000; 1Gbps+ plans grew by 1k.

  • Network Expansion:

  • 7,000 new addresses passed by fibre (total footprint: 1,532,000).

  • Fibre uptake up 0.1% to 72.1%; UFB2 areas increased to 62% penetration.

  • Copper Retirement:

  • Copper lines declined by 15k to 92k (only 13k remain in fibre areas), with full retirement planned by mid-2026.

  • Rural copper lines fell to 68k; satellite expected to overtake copper soon.

  • Regulatory & Strategic:

  • Commerce Commission draft recommends deregulating copper services (final decision by end-2025).

  • Proposal to expand fibre coverage from 87% to 95% of NZ households endorsed by Infrastructure Commission.

  • Product Update:

  • "Big Fibre Boost" completed: 50/10Mbps plans upgraded to 100/20Mbps, 300/100Mbps to 500/100Mbps (no wholesale cost increase).

No capital markets or liquidity-impacting changes identified.

• FY25 Results Announcement Date: 29 August 2025
  • Investor Briefing: NZST 11am on 29 August 2025 (webcast/conference call details provided)

No material trading or capital markets information identified.
